job_description: Sr. DevOps (AWS) Engineer - job post AccelPad Dallas, TX • Remote Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Contract AccelPad is seeking a Senior AWS DevOps Engineer to manage teams that will build and maintain solutions both on-premise and in AWS. If you have a solid knowledge on fundamental networking and strong Java development experience, this will be a perfect opportunity to grow your professional career. This is a 100% remote opportunity. Responsibilities Participate in the design and development of a cloud-based ML Learning platform and services Assist in building out the DevOps strategy for hosting and managing our microservice and connector infrastructure in AWS cloud Good track record of working with Java and distributed computing platforms in large enterprises where scale and complexity have been tackled Proven experience participating in agile development projects for enterprise-level systems component design and implementation Deep understanding and application of enterprise software design for implementation of data services and middleware. Good working knowledge of DevOps tools like Jenkins, Jira, Ansible, Terraform, CFT, etc Hands-on with CICD pipeline, Terraform, AWS EKS, Python, Shell scripting, and Linux. Proficient in building Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Delivery (CD), and Continuous Deployment pipelines using different DevOps tools. Experience in Infrastructure build and testing Automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation on AWS Familiarity interacting with AWS API. Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 8 plus years of experience in designing, building, and deploying secure, scalable, highly available applications in cloud environments. 5+ years of provisioning, operating, and managing AWS environments. An AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional and certified in at least one of these: Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), Docker Certified Associate (DCA), Puppet Certified Professional, DevOps Engineer Expert. Experienced engineer with hands on and good coding skills, preferably with Java, Python AWS Cloud experience – Proficient in container orchestration using Docker, Kubernetes, AWS ECS, and AWS EKS. EMR, S3, EFS, MSK, etc. Experience with Hadoop and various data formats like Parquet, CSV, etc. Knowledge and experience with Containerized Micro Services Hands-on experience with Kubernetes, Helm, GitOps Great attention to details with analytical/curious mind Organizational and communication skills Experience with machine learning a plus. "U.S. Citizens, Green Card holders and those authorized to work in the U.S. who do not need a Visa Sponsorship are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor or hire H1B at this time" Send me your resume directly to Chris.Castilla@accelpad.com
